data.title: Rising Star Grants for Artists
data.meta_description: Submit your application to compete as one of up to 10 finalists at our Celebration gala. The winner will be awarded a $5,000 Rising Star grant!
data.text:
The Howard County Arts Council established the Rising Star Award in 2003 to provide opportunities for emerging performing artists with roots in Howard County and to assist them in the development and practice of their art.

The goals of the Rising Star Award are to:

Encourage professional development in all performing arts disciplines

Recognize individual achievement in the performing arts

Support performing artists with strong ties to Howard County

Provide a venue for artists through a performance of award finalists

Individuals and ensembles are expected to audition live in the selected discipline with the members listed in the application at the Howard County Center for the Arts in Ellicott City.

Your audition piece must not exceed 3 minutes. If chosen as a finalist, you are expected to perform the auditioned piece with the same group members at the Celebration gala. When choosing your material, please keep in mind the Rising Star Award is determined by popular vote. Performance piece must be available through ASCAP’s ACE Repertory or be in the public domain; otherwise, artists are responsible for acquiring applicable licensing, including streaming.

Previous $5,000 award winners are not eligible to apply.

Howard County Arts Council reserves the right to extend the deadline and/or re-open the application process if an insufficient quantity or quality of applications are received. Decisions of the Review Panels, Performance Committee, Howard County Arts Council, and Celebration of the Arts audience are final. Howard County Arts Council is not obligated to provide a re-count of audience votes or explanation of any decisions. Submission of an application constitutes an understanding and agreement of the conditions set forth in these guidelines.

Applicants must be an individual performing artist or ensemble (maximum of four members) between the ages of 18 and 35 (at both the time of application and the final event) working in any performance discipline.

Individual Performing Artist: Defined as one who can stand alone in an onstage performance with no more than one accompanist or partner. Must currently or previously have lived, worked, performed regularly or received training in Howard County.

Duets: Must be able to stand alone in an onstage performance with no more than one additional accompanist. Must have at least one group member who has currently or previously lived, worked, performed regularly or received training in Howard County.

Trios/Quartets: Must be able to stand alone in an onstage performance with no more than one additional accompanist. Must have at least two group members who have currently or previously lived, worked, performed regularly or received training in Howard County.

All applicants must be available for auditions or provide an audition video (audio recordings will not be accepted) and be able to perform in Columbia, MD on the dates specified on the application form (only finalists will participate in the Celebration gala).

If selected to receive the award, applicants agree that they will provide a brief one-year follow-up statement regarding the impact of the award.

Previous $5,000 award winners are not eligible to apply.

Individuals and ensembles are expected to audition in the selected discipline with the members listed in the application.

Audition pieces must not exceed 3 minutes.

Artistic excellence considerations:

Artistic expression

Choice of material

Technical ability

Presentation (preparation and polish)

Audience appeal considerations:

Stage presence and charisma

Will material resonate with Celebration audiences

If chosen as a finalist by the Celebration Performance Committee, you are expected to perform the auditioned piece with the same group members at the Celebration gala. When choosing your material, please keep in mind the Rising Star Award is determined by popular vote at the gala.

Applicants will be notified in writing by the date listed in the application calendar as to the disposition of their application.
